frameDefinitions: An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.
A Ratifier responds to a Proposal constructed by another party to make it binding over the Ratifier's jurisdiction or constituency.

A Billing_authority communicates in written form that the Debtor owes the Owed_party (often the same as the Billing_authority) some amount of Money for certain Goods (including services) provided by the Owed_party or to clear a debt for a Bad_action by the Debtor against the Owed_party.
Words in the frame refer to any Document that has a legal status or conventional social significance.
An Assessor examines a Phenomenon to figure out its Value according to some Feature of the Phenomenon.
In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a Judge gives a Finding with respect to the Charges against the Defendant in a particular Case.
frameExamples: The <t>ratification</t> of the Kyoto protocol has been a long, hard slog.
They got their marriage <t>licence</t> from Canada.
Each company is then <t>evaluated</t> for their earning potential. CNI
He was <t>convicted</t> of fraud by Judge Judy.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.

The individual or body that confirms a Proposal negotiated or created by another party, causing it to become binding in a jurisdiction represented by the <fen>Ratifier</fen>.  In the case of direct democratic ratification, the jurisdiction and the <fen>Ratifier</fen> are the same.
The idea or course of action proposed by another individual or body which the <fen>Ratifier</fen> endorses and makes binding.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Ratifier</fen> makes the <fen>Proposal</fen> binding.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Ratifier</fen> ratifies the <fen>Proposal</fen>.
The person (or organization) that owes the <fen>Owed_party</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
<fen>Money</fen> is the thing given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction, or as recompense for the <fen>Bad_action</fen>.
In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of <fen>Goods</fen>.

The <fen>Owed_party</fen> expects a specific amount of <fen>Money</fen> from the <fen>Debtor</fen>, either because the <fen>Debtor</fen> received <fen>Goods</fen> or because the <fen>Debtor</fen> performed a Bad_action against the Owed_party.
The individual who communicates to the <fen>Debtor</fen> the <fen>Money</fen> that they owe.

An earlier action by the <fen>Debtor</fen> causing harm (directly or indirectly) to the <fen>Owed_party</fen>, for which the <fen>Owed_party</fen> expects compensation, and therefore bills the <fen>Debtor</fen>.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The holder of the document.
The authority that issues the document.
Obligation is the obligation that is imposed on the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>.
Right is the right of the <fen>Bearer</fen> of the <fen>Document</fen>  that is authorized by the <fen>Document</fen>.
Status is the state of the Bearer of the Document indicated by the Document.
Document is the piece of paper that has the legal status.
The sentient entity that evaluates the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The entity whose <fen>Value</fen> according to a <fen>Feature</fen> is being measured.
The type of property or feature that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is being judged on.
An event or procedure that allows the <fen>Assessor</fen> to evaluate the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Assessor</fen> to make the assessment.
The time at which the <fen>Assessor</fen> makes the assessment.
The location where the assessing takes place.
The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE.
The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.
This role refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.
The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.
If <fex>we</fex> ratify Management 's plan , we 'll have to take a drug test every week !
President Aleksander Kwasniewski ratified <fex>protocols to the Europol Convention</fex>.
The pizza man billed <fex>Lee</fex> $35 for his order.
The man at the counter billed Lee <fex>for his dry-cleaning</fex>.
The clerk invoiced the little old lady <fex>$49.95</fex> for what she called 'a little hand-holding . '
The cleaner bills <fex>at forty dollars per hour</fex> for his services.
<fex>The salesman</fex> never billed me , so I did n't pay .
<fex>My </fex> visa will expire next month.
<fex>US consulate</fex> issued a Visa to Ms. Yang to travel to San Francisco.
They were all under subpoena <fex>to appear in court.</fex>
Raymond has a <fex>fishing</fex> licence.
The couple just got their <fex>marriage</fex> certificate.
The police need a search <fex><t>warrant</t></fex> to enter his house.
You will also be graded <fex>on your speed of response</fex> .
<fex>The study</fex> evaluated the risk of a major quake.
<fex>This chapter</fex> evaluates the far-left's contribution to the environmentalism debate since the '70's .
The committee rated Smithers ' most loyal servant ' <fex>about a week ago</fex> .
They 'll evaluate you <fex>in that room over there</fex> , and then you 're free to go .

sourceCandidateSpans.text: ARIA's Code of Practice for ARIA Charts
